meanings.definition: A structure in a rock formed by pressure solution along a plane of weakness.
meanings.sent1: The stylolite in the rock showed where the pressure caused a line to form.
meanings.sent2: Geologists study stylolites to understand how rocks change under pressure.
meanings.sent3: The stylolite in the rock looked like a tiny crack trying to escape.
meanings.sent4: The stylolite in the rock was like a secret message written by nature.
meanings.sent5: The stylolite in the rock was as clear as a line drawn in the sand.

meanings.definition: To form stylolites in a rock.
meanings.sent1: Over time, the rocks stylolite, creating interesting patterns.
meanings.sent2: Minerals can stylolite when pressure causes them to dissolve slightly.
meanings.sent3: The rocks seemed to stylolite as if they were trying to fit together better.
meanings.sent4: The process of stylolite can take millions of years to occur naturally.
meanings.sent5: The way the rocks stylolite reminded me of how sugar dissolves in water.
